comment: Take him! Very nice guy who gives great lectures. Practiced as an attorney for most of his career, so he really knows his stuff and is able to explain concepts very well. Gives real world examples that make the content easy to digest. Posts all of his PowerPoints and the tests are open note with laptop use. Best BLAW professor you're going to get.

Prof Hartnig is a very straightforward professors I have ever taken. 4 tests including the final and a written assignment which is the only thing that would give students trouble. There are also roughly 15 Connect assignments but he makes them all due the day before the final. Tests are open laptop. Attendance not necessary. Super easy to get an A.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE HIM! He allows you to use laptops and most questions can be found offline. Dont have to go to class either. 1 paper that was super easy. Overall a super easy A.
The easiest class Ive ever taken. Open note tests. The lectures arent for credit. Study the smart book and you will get an A

Easiest class ever. I only went to 5 classes and got an A. All tests are open note/open laptop and you can find all the answers online. Also a funny guy. Highly recommend taking Hartnig to get that easy A.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the nicest professors I've had! He's willing to work with you for the grade you want. You'll have three tests, learn smart assignments, and a written assignment. On the test you're allowed to use your laptop and he basically gives you the answers to the written assignment. It's no way you can fail this class!

He is the best! He is a fair grader and gives you all that you need to know in class. There are a few tests and a final, and he has a review day for each test. There is online homework that can ALL be done in a few sittings. Great guy, very understanding- would take him again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Definitely, recommend Hartnig! It's an easy A, but that doesn't mean you don't learn. I definitely learned a lot reading through and answering the questions. The online program he uses zips right to the important information making studying and homework pretty speedy! Quizlet is actually slower than using the book and reading to answer questions

What an easy class! I am taking this class along with 2 others, and I am able to balance them along with working full time! He is easy to get along with, emails back fast. When I saw that you could use your computers for test , I'm like" yeah right"... But you actually can ! He is a bit boring on the lecture side, but B-law is boring anyways.!

3 or 4 tests (he changed it to 4 last semester, he might change it back), Learnsmart assignments and 3 writing assignments. Tests are open note, be sure to take notes on his powerpoints and the book to get all the material for the test. Don't forget to do the Learnsmarts on Connect, they're an easy 100 and worth 30%ish of your grade!
Low stress class, open note tests & a few other projects/papers all with optional partners. He's very caring and I would take his class again.

Don't need to even show up for class as he just reads over powerpoints already posted online. Just make sure to study the chapters in the books and its an easy class as you can use your notes and laptop as well. Would take again for sure!

This will probably be the easiest BLAW class you can find at KSU. His tests are all open note/book and you can use laptops. The writing assignments may be the only troublesome area. However, hes a very lenient grader. Make sure to do all the homeworks on time. They are super easy and make up a lot of points in the end.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
